fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.salter.util

Class LottoMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.salter.util.LottoMachine

  • public class LottoMachine
extends java.lang.Object
    Class LottoMachine holds different methods regarding lottery process. LottoMachine sets lotto type, it gets lotto type and calculates (= draws) lotto. It also gets and sets and gets again the user's row.

    • Method Detail

      • setLottoType

        public static void setLottoType(java.lang.String lottoT)
        Method setLottoType sets both lotto row's length and the number pool's top limit. The lotto types, which these numbers depend on are predefined. User get's to choose from them at the start of the game. Choices for user at the moment are 'regular lotto' and ' Big Win lotto'. Number pool's range starts by default from 1.
        Parameters:
        lottoT - argument, which tells if the lotto type has been figured already on commandline. If so, sets lotto type based on this.

      • setLotto

        public static void setLotto(java.lang.String[] cmdInput)
        Method setLotto defines lotto type by the given arguments at commandline. If there are none given, the program proceeds accordingly. If something has been inserted on the commandline, method cheks it's validity and if input is valid, figures the lotto type based on it.
        Parameters:
        cmdInput, - argument, which holds the possible commandline input

      • setUserRow

        public static void setUserRow(java.lang.String lottoType,
                              java.lang.String[] cmdInput)
        Method setUserRow sets user row depending either via commandline input or by asking it number by number from the user.
        Parameters:
        lottoType - argument, which tells how many numbers and from what range are needed for user row
        cmdInput - argument, that gives the user row given in the commandline

      • getUserRow

        public static int[] getUserRow()
        Method getUserRow returns the user row.
        Returns:
        int array

        Returns:

      • calculateLotto

        public static int[] calculateLotto(int poolSize,
                                   int lottoRowLength)
        Method that calculates ( or more accurately raffles ) lotto row from given range of numbers ( poolSize ).
        Parameters:
        poolSize - argument, which defines the number pool
        lottoRowLength - argument, which defines the number of numbers in lotto row
        Returns:
        int array
